item.title: Adrien Peyrache
item.description:
New paper from the lab!We observed beautiful sequences of spiking activity during sleep in the « head-direction cortex » (aka post-subiculum), traveling along its dorsoventral axis. Using in vivo data analysis, computation models, and slice physiology, we show that the hyperpolarization-activated current (Ih) supports this sequential neuronal activation. Analyzing data from other cortical regions, we believe that this is a general mechanism of spiking sequences during sleep.See our preprint:
https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.09.12.557442v1This manuscript contains obviously more than the short summary above. Comments are more than welcome!Huge kudos to @dlevenstein and @dhruvmehrotra5 for their hard work, Adrian Duszkiewicz, Brendon Watson, and Sofia Skromne Carrasco for the data. Also, great collaboration on the slice physiology with Sam Booker and Angelika Kwiatkowska at the University or Edinburgh. Big thanks to all the funding agencies (I mean, the tax payers) and other organizations for the financial support!

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
Wow! 124 brain researchers call out what journalists call the "leading theory of consciousness" (integrated information theory, IIT) as pseudoscience.https://psyarxiv.com/zsr78/💯​: We need testable theories about the brain to move forward. Every theory starts as a proto-theory (and that's fine). But when theories are not even wrong
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Not_even_wrong
we must acknowledge that. Especially when the stakes are as high as they are here, with big ethical implications (eg for organoids and coma patients, as the authors describe).

item.title: Snowgaze ❄️
item.description: This is "the thread". An Austrian, bothered with the lack of action by government on #inflation , built a software to track supermarkets prices. Then it got interesting. The data shows signs of oligopolic practices, supermarkets having the same price changes at the same time, and how variable prices (same product with or without discount) make it difficult to the consumer to show that prices have increased, while feeling it in their pockets. Read it, it's a great story.https://mastodon.gamedev.place/@badlogic/111071396799790275
